alert.note: Alert for Camden; Dallas; Hickory; Laclede; Polk; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 2:23PM CDT until July 17 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hickory County in central Missouri... Northern Dallas County in southwestern Missouri... Northwestern Laclede County in southwestern Missouri... Northern Polk County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern St. Clair County in west central Missouri... Southwestern Camden County in central Missouri... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 223 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Lebanon to 7 miles west of Macks Creek to near Osceola, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Pomme de Terre Lake, Pomme De Terre State Park, Bennett Spring State Park, Pittsburg, Humansville, Polk, Hermitage, Weaubleau, Urbana, Wheatland, Macks Creek, Preston, Collins, Flemington, Bennett Springs, Louisburg, Vista, Gerster and Windyville. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Dallas; Hickory; Laclede; Polk; St. Clair
